org.sd.wn
Class BasePointerFilter

java.lang.Object
  org.sd.wn.BasePointerFilter
All Implemented Interfaces:
PointerFilter
Direct Known Subclasses:
ConsistentPointerFilter, UnlimitedPointerFilter
public class BasePointerFilter
extends java.lang.Object
implements PointerFilter

Base implementation of the pointer filter interface.

Author:
Spence Koehler

          Default constructor rejects reverse relations for expansion.

Constructor Detail

BasePointerFilter

public BasePointerFilter()
Default constructor rejects reverse relations for expansion.

BasePointerFilter

public BasePointerFilter(boolean rejectReverseRelations,
                         java.lang.Integer maxDepth,
                         PointerSymbol[] acceptPointers,
                         PointerSymbol[] rejectPointers)
Construct with the given parameters.

Note that even if the rejectReverseRelations parameter is false, the direct source leading to a word sense will not be in the word sense's expansion set.

Method Detail

setRejectReverseRelations

protected final void setRejectReverseRelations(boolean rejectReverseRelations)
Set whether reverse relations should be rejected.

Note that even if this is false, the direct source leading to a word sense will not be in the word sense's expansion set.

rejectReverseRelations

protected final boolean rejectReverseRelations()
Determine whether reverse relations will be rejected.

setMaxDepth

protected final void setMaxDepth(java.lang.Integer maxDepth)
Set the maxDepth for expansion.

If null, negative, or zero, then there will be no limit.

getMaxDepth

protected final java.lang.Integer getMaxDepth()
Get the maxDepth for expansion.

Null indicates no limit.

addAcceptPointer

protected final void addAcceptPointer(PointerSymbol acceptPointer)
Add a type of pointer to accept. If there are no pointers added here, all are accepted. Once there are pointers added here, only the pointers that have been added will be accepted.

addRejectPointer

protected final void addRejectPointer(PointerSymbol rejectPointer)
Add a type of pointer to reject. If there are no pointers added here, all are accepted. Once there are pointers added here, only the pointers that have not been added will be accepted.

getAcceptPointers

protected final java.util.Set<PointerSymbol> getAcceptPointers()
Get the accept pointers, possibly null.

getRejectPointers

protected final java.util.Set<PointerSymbol> getRejectPointers()
Get the reject pointers, possibly null.

accept

public boolean accept(WordNetFile.Pointer pointer,
                      WordSenseWrapper source)
Accept a relation for expansion from the source unless rejecting reverse relations and the proposed pointer is a reverse relation from what has been expanded in any source wrapper.

Extending classes should call this (super) method and check for other relevant constraints.

Specified by:
accept in interface PointerFilter

accept

public boolean accept(WordSenseWrapper expanded,
                      WordSenseWrapper source)
Determine whether to accept the given expansion from the source word sense.

Specified by:
accept in interface PointerFilter

acceptPointer

protected boolean acceptPointer(WordNetFile.Pointer pointer,
                                WordSenseWrapper source)
Determine whether the pointer should be accepted for expansion.

Note that this is applied after checking for reverse relations if applicable.

Extending classes can override this for desired behavior. If this method is overridden then the default accept/reject pointer behavior will not be automatically applied.

acceptPOS

protected boolean acceptPOS(POS partOfSpeech,
                            WordSenseWrapper source)
Determine whether the part of speech should be accepted for expansion.

Extending classes can override this for desired behavior.

acceptLexName

public boolean acceptLexName(LexName lexName,
                             WordSenseWrapper source)
Determine whether the lex name should be accepted for expansion.

Extending classes can override this for desired behavior.
